intro: Lasianthus areolatus, commonly known as the spotted flame bamboo, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight.
